oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1949-11-06 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1949-11-06, part 2. Personnel include Ott Devine (announcer), Snooky Lanson (host, performer), Beasley Smith (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer), Lion Chorus (performer), Dottie Dillard (performer), and Margaret Whiting (performer). Held at the Ryman Auditorium.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Beasley Smith; Lion Orchestra; Snooky Lanson; Margaret Whiting
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Margaret Whiting and Ott Devine talk -- Lion Oil commercial (Ott Devine) -- Margaret Whiting, Snooky Lanson and Dottie Dillard talk -- Holiday For Strings (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Snooky Lanson, Dottie Dillard and Margaret Whiting talk -- Dime A Dozen (Margaret Whiting) -- Snooky Lanson, Dottie Dillard and Margaret Whiting talk -- My Ideal / (talk) / It Might As Well Be Spring / (talk) / Far Away Places (medley) (Margaret Whiting) -- You Was (Margaret Whiting, Snooky Lanson) -- Closing theme (Beasley Smith and the Lion Orchestra) -- Closing statement (Snooky Lanson, Margaret Whiting) -- Closing statement (Ott Devine)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Sunday down south (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Devine, Ott, 1910-1994; Lanson, Snooky; Smith, Beasley; Lion Orchestra (Musical group); Lion Chorus (Musical group); Dillard, Dottie; Whiting, Margaret
